qas.question: According to a report in 2011, by what year could solar energy provide a third of the world's energy?
What could the sun's energy do to help limit climate change?

answers.text: could play a key role in de-carbonizing the global economy alongside improvements in energy efficiency and imposing costs on greenhouse gas emitters

context: In 2011, a report by the International Energy Agency found that solar energy technologies such as photovoltaics, solar hot water and concentrated solar power could provide a third of the world’s energy by <a0_0>2060<a0_0/> if politicians commit to limiting climate change. The energy from the sun <a1_0>could play a key role in de-carbonizing the global economy alongside improvements in energy efficiency and imposing costs on greenhouse gas emitters<a1_0/>. "The strength of solar is the incredible variety and flexibility of applications, from small scale to big scale".
